text:
Thinking to start a business Just to save tax... Well I don't buy that. One needs a good product / concept/ idea that can solve a problem or can fulfill a gap or can create a better value proposition than existing products available.. If not then business with no Vision no problem solving ability is bound to fail and can be more taxing....

But I do agree with you that if one starts a business, then, these tax benefit opportunities should not be ignored... Thanks for the info, Akshat. üôÇüëç

text: Instead of talking about Warren buffet, Tesla, Kushner etc, would have loved to see more examples from the Indian context. Eg, Mukesh Ambani is the richest man, but is he the highest tax payer?? Not just agricultural income, income earned by politicians is also not taxed. There are many loopholes in the Indian system as well. That many wealthy people in India can also use to save/avoid paying taxes... Just a food for thought
